type.name: status
type.summary: Status code describing the result of a command

element.name: credential
element.summary: A credential consisting of type, service, port, username and password.

example.summary: SSH Credential with username + password authentication and port
SSH Credential with username + SSH Key authentication and port
ESXi Credential with username + password authentication
Kerberos Credentials. The kdc value is only used when no matching realm was found.

element.name: scanner_params
element.summary: Contains elements that represent scanner specific parameters

ele.name: e
ele.summary: Element that represents a scanner specific parameters

element.name: target
element.summary: A scan target consisting of hosts, a port selection and credentials

ele.name: hosts
ele.summary: One or many hosts. The list is comma-separated. Each entry can be a IP address, a CIDR notation, a hostname, a IP range. IPs can be v4 or v6

ele.name: ports
ele.summary: A list of ports that is the same for the given hosts

ele.name: credentials
ele.summary: One or many credentials containing the credential for the given hosts

ele.name: exclude_hosts
ele.summary: One or many hosts to exclude. The list is comma-separated. Each entry can be a IP address, a CIDR notation, a hostname, a IP range. IPs can be v4 or v6. Each wrapper must handle the exclude hosts

ele.name: finished_hosts
ele.summary: One or many finished hosts to exclude when the client resumes a task. The list is comma-separated. Each entry can be an IP address, a CIDR notation, a hostname, a IP range. IPs can be v4 or v6. The listed hosts will be set as finished before starting the scan. Each wrapper must handle the finished hosts

ele.name: alive_test
ele.summary: Alive test type to be performed against the target

ele.name: alive_test_methods
ele.summary: Alive test methods to be performed against the target

ele.name: icmp
ele.summary: ICMP ping

ele.name: tcp_syn
ele.summary: TCP-SYN ping

ele.name: tcp_ack
ele.summary: TCP-ACK ping

ele.name: arp
ele.summary: ARP ping

ele.name: consider_alive
ele.summary: Consider the target to be alive

ele.name: alive_test_ports
ele.summary: Dedicated port list for alive detection. Used for TCP-SYN and TCP-ACK ping when Boreas (scanner preference test_alive_hosts_only) is enabled. If no port list is provided ports 80, 137, 587, 3128, 8081 are used as defaults

ele.name: reverse_lookup_only
ele.summary: Only scan IP addresses that can be resolved into a DNS name

ele.name: reverse_lookup_unify
ele.summary: If multiple IP addresses resolve to the same DNS name the DNS name will only get scanned once

example.summary: VT group filtered by family name

element.name: vt_selection
element.summary: Contains elements that represent a Vulnerability Test or a collection of Vulnerability Tests to be executed and their parameters

example.summary: VT with parameters and VT group

attributes.format: Help format. Could be text or xml

check_feed.description: Perform sync feed self test and check lockfile status

attributes.scan_id: Optional UUID value to set as scan ID
attributes.target: Target hosts to scan in a comma-separated list
attributes.ports: Ports list to scan as comma-separated list
attributes.parallel: Optional number of parallel scans to run

attributes.scan_id: Mandatory ID of a specific scan to get
attributes.details: Whether to return the full scan report
attributes.progress: Whether to return a detailed progress information
attributes.pop_results: Whether to remove the fetched results
attributes.max_results: Maximum number of results to fetch. Only considered if pop_results is enabled. Default = None, which means that all available results are returned

attributes.title: Name of report.
attributes.start: Time of first data point in report.
attributes.end: Time of last data point in report.

command.name: get_performance
command.summary: Return performance information from an external program

command.name: get_scans
command.summary: Get a stored scan in buffer

attrib.name: details
attrib.summary: Whether to get full scan reports

attrib.name: progress
attrib.summary: Whether to return a detailed progress information

attrib.name: pop_results
attrib.summary: Whether to remove the fetched results

attrib.name: max_results
attrib.summary: Maximum number of results to fetch. Only considered if pop_results is enabled. Default = None, which means that all available results are returned

scan.results:
The URL: "https://192.168.1.252/" has a path disclosure vulnerability which discloses "/var/www/phpinfo.php" ...
...

results.result: The URL: "https://192.168.1.252/" has a path disclosure vulnerability which discloses "/var/www/phpinfo.php" ...

example.summary: Get protocol, scanner and daemon versions

command.name: check_feed
command.summary: Perform sync feed self test and check lockfile status

example.summary: Perform sync feed self test and check lockfile status

attrib.name: list_all
attrib.summary: List all available scanner parameters. Not only those visible to the client.

scanner_param.name: Scan profile
scanner_param.description: Scan profiles are predefined set of plugins and customized configurations.

scanner_param.name: Show HTTP request status
scanner_param.description: Whether to show the HTTP request's status in results

scanner_param.name: Show HTTP request headers
scanner_param.description: Whether to show the HTTP request's headers in results

scanner_param.name: Show HTTP response status
scanner_param.description: Whether to show the HTTP response's status in results

scanner_param.name: Debug Mode
scanner_param.description: Whether to get extra scan debug information.

scanner_param.name: Target port
scanner_param.description: Port on target host to scan

scanner_param.name: Use HTTPS
scanner_param.description: Whether the target application is running over HTTPS

command.name: get_vts
command.summary: Return information about vulnerability tests, if offered by scanner

attrib.name: filter
attrib.summary: Filter to get a sub group of a VT collection

attrib.name: details
attrib.summary: Return more details about vulnerability tests, if offered by the scanner

ele.name: origin
ele.summary: Optional reference to the origin of the severity

ele.name: date
ele.summary: Optional timestamp in seconds since epoch. Defaults to VT creation date

ele.name: value
ele.summary: The actual value, the format must correspond with the type

example.summary: Get information for all available vulnerability tests

vt.name: Check for presence of vulnerability X
Check for presence of vulnerability Y

example.summary: Get information for a single vulnerability test

vt.name: Check for presence of vulnerability X
vt.insight: App is a small but very powerful app.
vt.detection: Get the installed version with the help of detect NVT and check if the version is vulnerable or not.

example.summary: Get information for a filtered collection of vulnerability test without details

vt.name: Check for presence of vulnerability X
vt.insight: App is a small but very powerful app.
vt.detection: Get the installed version with the help of detect NVT and check if the version is vulnerable or not.

example.summary: Get information for a vulnerability test with custom data

vt.name: Check for presence of vulnerability X

example.summary: Get information for a vulnerability test with VT parameters data

vt.name: Check for presence of vulnerability X

attrib.name: target
attrib.summary: Target hosts to scan in a comma-separated list

attrib.name: ports
attrib.summary: Ports list to scan as comma-separated list

attrib.name: scan_id
attrib.summary: Optional UUID value to use as scan ID

attrib.name: parallel
attrib.summary: Optional number of parallel scan to run

ele.name: scanner_params
ele.summary: Contains elements that represent scanner specific parameters

ele.name: vt_selection
ele.summary: Contains elements that represent a Vulnerability Test or a collection of Vulnerability Tests to be executed and their parameters

ele.name: targets
ele.summary: Contains a single element that represent a target to execute a scan against. If target and port attributes are present this element is not take into account

ele.name: id
ele.summary: New scan's UUID

example.summary: Start a new scan. Legacy mode
Start a new scan with. Target element has port list and credentials for authenticated scans.

command.name: get_memory_usage
command.summary: Return memory usage information of the osp daemon

attrib.name: unit
attrib.summary: Size unit for the memory. b for bytes, kb for kilobytes and mb for megabytes.

ele.name: processes
ele.summary: List of running processes

ele.name: process
ele.summary: Single running processes

ele.name: rss
ele.description: Resident Set Size. Non-swapped physical memory of the process

ele.name: vms
ele.description: Virtual Memory Size. Total amount of virtual memory used by the process.

parameter_type.name: selection
parameter_type.summary: A value out of the | separated values list

parameter_type.name: ovaldef_file
parameter_type.summary: An ovaldef file's content that is base64 encoded

change.summary: New command to perform a sync feed self test
change.description: Perform a sync feed self test and check if the lockfile is locked
Include as arguments the feed's vendor, name and home.
Include as arguments the feed's vendor, name and home.

change.summary: Add support for privileged access to target
change.description: Credential Element got new Elements in case of SSH type. These new Elements allow an additional root access to the target system.

change.summary: Add support for dedicated port list for alive detection
change.description: Target element received new target option alive_test_ports.

change.summary: Add support for supplying alive test methods via separate elements.
change.description: Target element received new optional target option alive_test_methods with subelements imcp, tcp_ack, tcp_syn, arp and consider_alive.

change.summary: Returned object changes and extends severity information
change.description: The element SEVERITY inside SEVERITIES of the returned VT moves the origin and the value into explicit elements ORIGIN and VALUE. Furthremore the element DATE is added.

change.summary: Returned object extended with solution method
change.description: The element SOLUTION of the returned VT object has a new optional attribute METHOD that describes the solution method in case the VT offers such a detail.

change.summary: Returned object extended with amount of VTS
change.description: The main element vts has the new TOTAL attribute with the amount of vts in the collection and the new optional SENT attribute with the amount of vts which matched a given filter.
The new attribute DETAILS allows to get more details about a vulnerability test if the scanner support it. By default is set True, and for a lighter response must be explicitly set to False.
The new attribute SHA256_HASH is calculated from the vulnerability test OID, modification time and VT preferences, sorted by OID. The new attribute is helpful for feed integrity check.
The feed version is included in the get_vts command response.
Target element receive new target options reverse_lookup_only, reverse_lookup_unify and alive_test.
New attribute PROGRESS to specify whether to return a detailed progress information.
Added new command to retrieve information about vulnerability tests a scanner might offer.
Added optional element vts to allow the client to specify a vts list to use for the scan and their parameters.
Added optional element targets to specify different hosts with a different port list and credentials. This is take in account only if target and port attributes are not present in start_scan tag.
Added optional attribute parallel to specify the number of simultaneous scans to be run.
Added new command to stop a currently running scan.

description.p: The scan_id attribute was added to allow the client to specify a UUID as the ID of the scan.

change.description: The ports attribute was added to allow the client to specify a ports list to use for the scan.
Added new command to get performance from an external program.
Possibility of running multi-targets was not implemented. Currently, only the first target element is used and the following are ignored as well as parallel attribute.
